17  package spoon;
18  
19  import spoon.decompiler.CFRDecompiler;
20  import spoon.decompiler.Decompiler;
21  import spoon.support.compiler.FileSystemFolder;
22  
23  import java.io.File;
24  import java.io.IOException;
25  import java.nio.file.Files;
26  import java.nio.file.Path;
27  import java.nio.file.Paths;
28  import java.util.stream.Stream;
29  
30  /**
31   * Creates a FileSystemFolder containing the decompiled byte from another input directory
32   */
33  public class DecompiledResource extends FileSystemFolder {
34  
35  	/**
36  	 * Creates a FileSystemFolder containing the decompiled .class and .jar from path.
37  	 * The actual folder is located at pathToDecompiledSources.
38  	 * @param path path to the folder containing the bytecode to decompile
39  	 * @param classpath additional classpath that could help decompilation.
40  	 * @param decompiler decompiler to use. If null the default will be used.
41  	 * @param pathToDecompiledSources output directory for decompiled sources.
42  	 */
43  	public DecompiledResource(String path, String[] classpath, Decompiler decompiler, String pathToDecompiledSources) {
44  		super(pathToDecompiledSources);
45  
46  		final Decompiler decompilerToUse;
47  		if (decompiler == null) {
48  			decompilerToUse = new CFRDecompiler();
49  		} else {
50  			decompilerToUse = decompiler;
51  		}
52  
53  		File output = new File(pathToDecompiledSources);
54  		output.mkdirs();
55  
56  		try (Stream<Path> walk = Files.walk(Paths.get(path))) {
57  
58  			walk.filter(Files::isRegularFile)
59  					.filter(x -> x.toString().endsWith(".class") || x.toString().endsWith(".jar"))
60  					.map(x -> x.toString())
61  					.forEach(
62  						f -> decompilerToUse.decompile(f, pathToDecompiledSources, classpath)
63  					);
64  		} catch (IOException e) {
65  			e.printStackTrace();
66  		}
67  	}
68  }
